items.content:
615: :label: lem-hypocoercive-dissipation
616: 
617: For the kinetic generator $\mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}}$ with harmonic potential $U(x) = \frac{\kappa}{2}|x - x^*|^2$, there exist constants $\lambda, \mu > 0$ such that:

items.label: lem-log-concave-yang-mills
items.title: Log-Concavity for Pure Yang-Mills Vacuum
items.content:
1076: :label: lem-log-concave-yang-mills
1077: 
1078: For the Yang-Mills vacuum state, the log-concavity condition {prf:ref}`def-log-concavity-condition` is **satisfied**.
1079: 
1080: **Proof:**
1081: 
1082: **Step 1: Simplify the system**
1083: 
1084: For the Yang-Mills vacuum:
1085: - **Uniform reward**: $r(x) = r_0 = \text{constant}$ (no preferred field configuration in vacuum)
1086: - **Quadratic confinement**: $U(x) = \frac{\kappa_{\text{conf}}}{2}\|x\|^2$ (harmonic confining potential)
1087: 
1088: **Step 2: Analyze fitness potential**
1089: 
1090: With uniform reward, the fitness potential simplifies dramatically:
1091: $$
1092: V_{\text{fit}}(x) = \text{Rescale}(Z_r(x)) + \beta \cdot \text{Rescale}(Z_d(x))
1093: $$
1094: 
1095: where $Z_r(x) = 0$ (no reward gradient) and $Z_d(x)$ is the diversity Z-score (distance to companions).
1096: 
1097: For uniform reward:
1098: $$
1099: V_{\text{fit}}(x) \approx \beta \cdot f(d(x, \text{swarm center}))
1100: $$
1101: 
1102: where $f$ is a smooth, slowly-varying function.
1103: 
1104: **Step 3: Compute emergent metric**
1105: 
1106: $$
1107: H(x) = \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}(x) \approx \beta \cdot \nabla^2 f
1108: $$
1109: 
1110: For a smooth diversity term, $\|\nabla^2 f\| = O(1)$ is bounded. With regularization:
1111: $$
1112: g(x) = H(x) + \epsilon_\Sigma I \approx \beta \cdot O(1) + \epsilon_\Sigma I \approx \text{const} \cdot I
1113: $$
1114: 
1115: **The metric is approximately flat**: $g(x) \approx c I$ for some constant $c > 0$.
1116: 
1117: **Step 4: Analyze effective potential**
1118: 
1119: $$
1120: U_{\text{eff}}(x) = U(x) - \epsilon_F V_{\text{fit}}(x) = \frac{\kappa_{\text{conf}}}{2}\|x\|^2 - \epsilon_F \beta f(d(x, \text{center}))
1121: $$
1122: 
1123: For $\epsilon_F$ small (weak adaptive force), the confining term dominates:
1124: $$
1125: U_{\text{eff}}(x) \approx \frac{\kappa_{\text{conf}}}{2}\|x\|^2 \quad \text{(quadratic)}
1126: $$
1127: 
1128: **Step 5: QSD formula**
1129: 
1130: $$
1131: \rho_{\text{QSD}}(x) \approx \text{const} \cdot \exp\left(-\frac{\kappa_{\text{conf}}\|x\|^2}{2T}\right)
1132: $$
1133: 
1134: **This is a Gaussian distribution**, which is the canonical example of a log-concave probability measure.
1135: 
1136: **Step 6: Perturbation argument**
1137: 
1138: The small corrections from non-zero $\epsilon_F$ are **smooth perturbations** of the Gaussian. By continuity of log-concavity under small perturbations in the supremum norm:
1139: $$
1140: \|\rho_{\text{pert}} - \rho_{\text{Gaussian}}\|_{\infty} = O(\epsilon_F) \implies \rho_{\text{pert}} \text{ is log-concave}
1141: $$

items.title: Conditional Independence of Cloning
items.content:
1199: :label: lem-cloning-conditional-independence
1200: 
1201: Conditioned on the alive set $\mathcal{A}(S)$ and the virtual rewards $\{r_i^{\text{virt}}\}_{i \in \mathcal{A}}$, the cloning operator acts **independently** on each dead walker:
1202: 
1203: $$
1204: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S) | \mathcal{A}, \{r_i^{\text{virt}}\} = \prod_{i \in \mathcal{D}} K_i^{\text{clone}}(w_i | \mathcal{A}, \{r_j^{\text{virt}}\}_{j \in \mathcal{A}})
1205: $$

items.label: lem-cloning-wasserstein-contraction
items.title: Wasserstein-2 Contraction for Cloning
items.content:
1245: :label: lem-cloning-wasserstein-contraction
1246: 
1247: The cloning operator with Gaussian noise contracts the 2-Wasserstein distance. Specifically, for two swarm states $S_1, S_2$:
1248: 
1249: $$
1250: \mathbb{E}[W_2^2(\mu_{S_1'}, \mu_{S_2'})] \le (1 - \kappa_W) W_2^2(\mu_{S_1}, \mu_{S_2}) + C_W
1251: $$

items.title: Entropy-Transport Dissipation Inequality
items.content:
1452: :label: lem-entropy-transport-dissipation
1453: 
1454: For the cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ with parameters satisfying the Keystone Principle (Theorem 8.1 in [03_cloning](03_cloning)), there exists $\alpha > 0$ such that:

1457: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) \le D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) - \alpha \cdot W_2^2(\mu, \pi) + C_{\text{clone}}
1458: $$

items.label: lem-kinetic-evolution-bounds
items.title: Kinetic Evolution Bounds
items.content:
1584: :label: lem-kinetic-evolution-bounds
1585: 
1586: For the kinetic operator $\Psi_{\text{kin}}(\tau)$ from Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-kinetic-lsi`, we have:
1587: 
1588: **Entropy contraction:**
1589: 
1590: $$
1591: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu'' \| \pi) \le e^{-\rho_k} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi)
1592: $$
1593: 
1594: where $\rho_k = \alpha\tau/C_0$ with $\alpha = \min(\gamma/2, \kappa_{\text{conf}}/4)$ and $C_0 = O(1/\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}))$.
1595: 
1596: **Wasserstein expansion bound:**
1597: 
1598: $$
1599: W_2^2(\mu'', \pi) \le (1 + \beta) W_2^2(\mu', \pi)
1600: $$

items.label: lem-mean-field-cloning-sketch
items.title: Entropy Dissipation Under Cloning (Mean-Field Sketch)
items.content:
2315: :label: lem-mean-field-cloning-sketch
2316: 
2317: **Hypotheses:**
2318: 
2319: 1. $\mu, \pi$ are probability measures on $\Omega = X_{\text{valid}} \times V_{\text{alg}} \subset \mathbb{R}^{2d}$ with smooth densities:
2320:    - $\rho_\mu, \rho_\pi \in C^2(\Omega)$
2321:    - $\rho_\mu, \rho_\pi > 0$ on $\Omega$ (strictly positive)
2322: 
2323: 2. $\pi = \pi_{\text{QSD}}$ is log-concave ({prf:ref}`axiom-qsd-log-concave`):
2324:    $$\rho_\pi(z) = \exp(-V_{\text{QSD}}(z))$$
2325:    for convex $V_{\text{QSD}}$
2326: 
2327: 3. $T_{\text{clone}}: \mathcal{P}(\Omega) \to \mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ is the mean-field cloning operator with:
2328:    - Generator: $S[\rho] = S_{\text{src}}[\rho] - S_{\text{sink}}[\rho]$
2329:    - Post-cloning noise variance: $\delta^2$
2330:    - Cloning probability: $P_{\text{clone}}(V_i, V_j) = \min(1, V_j/V_i) \cdot \lambda_{\text{clone}}$
2331: 
2332: 4. **Fitness-QSD Anti-Correlation**:
2333:    $$\log V[z] = -\lambda_{\text{corr}} V_{\text{QSD}}(z) + \log V_0$$
2334:    for $\lambda_{\text{corr}} > 0$
2335: 
2336: 5. **Regularity bounds**:
2337:    - $0 < \rho_{\min} \leq \rho_\mu(z) \leq \rho_{\max} < \infty$
2338:    - $0 < V_{\min} \leq V[z] \leq V_{\max} < \infty$
2339: 
2340: **Conclusion (Conjectured):**
2341: 
2342: For $\mu' = T_{\text{clone}} \# \mu$ with infinitesimal time step $\tau$:
2343: 
2344: $$
2345: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) - D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) \leq -\tau \beta \, D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(\tau^2)
2346: $$
2347:
items.raw_directive:
2312: ## Lemma Statement
2313: 
2314: :::{prf:lemma} Entropy Dissipation Under Cloning (Mean-Field Sketch)
2315: :label: lem-mean-field-cloning-sketch
2316: 
2317: **Hypotheses:**
2318: 
2319: 1. $\mu, \pi$ are probability measures on $\Omega = X_{\text{valid}} \times V_{\text{alg}} \subset \mathbb{R}^{2d}$ with smooth densities:
2320:    - $\rho_\mu, \rho_\pi \in C^2(\Omega)$
2321:    - $\rho_\mu, \rho_\pi > 0$ on $\Omega$ (strictly positive)
2322: 
2323: 2. $\pi = \pi_{\text{QSD}}$ is log-concave ({prf:ref}`axiom-qsd-log-concave`):
2324:    $$\rho_\pi(z) = \exp(-V_{\text{QSD}}(z))$$
2325:    for convex $V_{\text{QSD}}$
2326: 
2327: 3. $T_{\text{clone}}: \mathcal{P}(\Omega) \to \mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ is the mean-field cloning operator with:
2328:    - Generator: $S[\rho] = S_{\text{src}}[\rho] - S_{\text{sink}}[\rho]$
2329:    - Post-cloning noise variance: $\delta^2$
2330:    - Cloning probability: $P_{\text{clone}}(V_i, V_j) = \min(1, V_j/V_i) \cdot \lambda_{\text{clone}}$
2331: 
2332: 4. **Fitness-QSD Anti-Correlation**:
2333:    $$\log V[z] = -\lambda_{\text{corr}} V_{\text{QSD}}(z) + \log V_0$$
2334:    for $\lambda_{\text{corr}} > 0$
2335: 
2336: 5. **Regularity bounds**:
2337:    - $0 < \rho_{\min} \leq \rho_\mu(z) \leq \rho_{\max} < \infty$
2338:    - $0 < V_{\min} \leq V[z] \leq V_{\max} < \infty$
2339: 
2340: **Conclusion (Conjectured):**
2341: 
2342: For $\mu' = T_{\text{clone}} \# \mu$ with infinitesimal time step $\tau$:
2343: 
2344: $$
2345: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) - D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) \leq -\tau \beta \, D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(\tau^2)
2346: $$
2347: 
2348: where $\beta > 0$ (contraction rate) and $C_{\text{ent}} < 0$ (favorable entropy term) depend on the parameters.

items.label: lem-meanfield-cloning-dissipation-hybrid
items.title: Mean-Field Cloning Entropy Dissipation
items.content:
3890: :label: lem-meanfield-cloning-dissipation-hybrid
3891: 
3892: **Hypotheses**:
3893: 
3894: 1. $\mu, \pi$ are probability measures on $\Omega \subset \mathbb{R}^{2d}$ with smooth densities $\rho_\mu, \rho_\pi \in C^2(\Omega)$
3895: 2. $\pi = \pi_{\text{QSD}}$ is log-concave: $\rho_\pi = e^{-V_{\text{QSD}}}$ for convex $V_{\text{QSD}}$
3896: 3. $T_{\text{clone}}: \mathcal{P}(\Omega) \to \mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ is the mean-field cloning operator
3897: 4. Fitness-QSD anti-correlation: $\log V[z] = -\lambda_{\text{corr}} V_{\text{QSD}}(z) + \log V_0$ with $\lambda_{\text{corr}} > 0$
3898: 5. Regularity: $0 < \rho_{\min} \leq \rho_\mu \leq \rho_{\max} < \infty$ and $0 < V_{\min} \leq V[z] \leq V_{\max} < \infty$
3899: 6. Noise regime: $\delta^2 > \delta_{\min}^2$
3900: 
3901: **Conclusion**:
3902: 
3903: For $\mu' = T_{\text{clone}} \# \mu$ with infinitesimal time step $\tau$:
3904: 
3905: $$
3906: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) \leq (1 - \tau \beta_{\text{clone}}) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + O(\tau^2)
3907: $$
3908: 
3909: where:
3910: $$
3911: \beta_{\text{clone}} := \frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \lambda_{\text{corr}} \lambda_{\text{Poin}} (1 - \epsilon_{\text{ratio}}) > 0
3912: $$
3913: 
3914: and:
3915: $$
3916: C_{\text{ent}} := \tau \lambda_{\text{clone}} \left[\log\left(\frac{\rho_{\max}}{\rho_{\min}}\right) - \frac{d}{2} \log(2\pi e \delta^2)\right] < 0

3897: 4. Fitness-QSD anti-correlation: $\log V[z] = -\lambda_{\text{corr}} V_{\text{QSD}}(z) + \log V_0$ with $\lambda_{\text{corr}} > 0$
3898: 5. Regularity: $0 < \rho_{\min} \leq \rho_\mu \leq \rho_{\max} < \infty$ and $0 < V_{\min} \leq V[z] \leq V_{\max} < \infty$
3899: 6. Noise regime: $\delta^2 > \delta_{\min}^2$
3900: 
3901: **Conclusion**:
3902: 
3903: For $\mu' = T_{\text{clone}} \# \mu$ with infinitesimal time step $\tau$:
3904: 
3905: $$
3906: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) \leq (1 - \tau \beta_{\text{clone}}) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + O(\tau^2)
3907: $$
3908:

4549: C_{\text{ent}} = \tau \lambda_{\text{clone}} \left[\log\left(\frac{\rho_{\max}}{\rho_{\min}}\right) - \frac{d}{2} \log(2\pi e \delta^2)\right] < 0
4550: $$

items.section: ## Section 2: Cloning Operator LSI (Mean-Field Generator Analysis)
items.raw_directive:
4531: ### 2.3. Main Lemma
4532: 
4533: :::{prf:lemma} Mean-Field Cloning Contraction
4534: :label: lem-cloning-contraction-standalone
4535: 
4536: Under Hypotheses 1-4, for infinitesimal time step $\tau$:
4537: 
4538: $$
4539: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi) \leq (1 - \tau \beta_{\text{clone}}) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_{\text{ent}} + O(e^{-\kappa \delta^2}) + O(\tau^2)
4540: $$
4541: 
4542: where:
4543: $$
4544: \beta_{\text{clone}} = \frac{\lambda_{\text{clone}}}{m_a} \lambda_{\text{corr}} \lambda_{\text{Poin}} (1 - \epsilon_{\text{ratio}})
4545: $$
4546: 
4547: and:
4548: $$
4549: C_{\text{ent}} = \tau \lambda_{\text{clone}} \left[\log\left(\frac{\rho_{\max}}{\rho_{\min}}\right) - \frac{d}{2} \log(2\pi e \delta^2)\right] < 0
4550: $$
4551: 
4552: for $\delta^2 > \delta_{\min}^2$.

items.label: lem-softmax-lipschitz-status
items.title: Lipschitz Continuity of Softmax-Weighted Companion Selection
items.content:
5945: :label: lem-softmax-lipschitz-status
5946: 
5947: Let $\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2$ be two swarms with $d_{\text{status}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2) = n_c$ status changes. For a walker $i$ alive in both swarms, let $\text{Comp}_i^{(1)}, \text{Comp}_i^{(2)}$ be the probability distributions over companions selected by the Sequential Stochastic Greedy Pairing algorithm in each swarm.
5948: 
5949: For any bounded function $f: \mathcal{X} \times \mathcal{V} \to \mathbb{R}$ with $|f| \leq M_f$, the expected value under the softmax-weighted companion selection satisfies:
5950: 
5951: $$
5952: |\mathbb{E}_{j \sim \text{Comp}_i^{(1)}}[f(x_j, v_j)] - \mathbb{E}_{j \sim \text{Comp}_i^{(2)}}[f(x_j, v_j)]| \leq C_{\text{softmax}} \cdot \frac{M_f \cdot n_c}{k}
5953: $$
items.section: ## Part 3: Dobrushin Contraction for the Full Dynamics
items.raw_directive:
5942: The framework's Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-total-error-status-bound` in [01_fragile_gas_framework](../01_fragile_gas_framework.md) proves Lipschitz continuity for **uniform random companion selection**. However, the greedy pairing uses **softmax-weighted selection** based on algorithmic distance, so we must extend the proof to this case.
5943: 
5944: :::{prf:lemma} Lipschitz Continuity of Softmax-Weighted Companion Selection
5945: :label: lem-softmax-lipschitz-status
5946: 
5947: Let $\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2$ be two swarms with $d_{\text{status}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2) = n_c$ status changes. For a walker $i$ alive in both swarms, let $\text{Comp}_i^{(1)}, \text{Comp}_i^{(2)}$ be the probability distributions over companions selected by the Sequential Stochastic Greedy Pairing algorithm in each swarm.
5948: 
5949: For any bounded function $f: \mathcal{X} \times \mathcal{V} \to \mathbb{R}$ with $|f| \leq M_f$, the expected value under the softmax-weighted companion selection satisfies:
5950: 
5951: $$
5952: |\mathbb{E}_{j \sim \text{Comp}_i^{(1)}}[f(x_j, v_j)] - \mathbb{E}_{j \sim \text{Comp}_i^{(2)}}[f(x_j, v_j)]| \leq C_{\text{softmax}} \cdot \frac{M_f \cdot n_c}{k}
5953: $$

items.content:
7288: :label: lem-kinetic-lsi-established
7289: 
7290: The kinetic operator $\Psi_{\text{kin}}$ (Langevin dynamics) satisfies an LSI **with respect to its own invariant measure** $\pi_{\text{kin}}$:
7291: 
7292: $$
7293: \text{Ent}_{\pi_{\text{kin}}}(f^2) \leq C_{\text{LSI}}^{\text{kin}} \cdot \mathbb{E}_{\pi_{\text{kin}}}[|\nabla f|^2]
7294: $$
7295: 
7296: where:
7297: $$
7298: C_{\text{LSI}}^{\text{kin}} = \frac{1}{2\lambda_{\text{hypo}}}, \quad \lambda_{\text{hypo}} = c \cdot \min\left(\gamma, \frac{\alpha_U}{\sigma_v^2}\right)
7299: $$
7300: 
7301: **Crucially**: This holds for **non-convex** $U(x)$ via hypocoercivity.
